            BIODIVERSITY STRATEGY,TF028370-GEF1-CONSERVATION &

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Conservation and
            Sustainable Use of Medicinal Plants Project is to conserve
            globally and nationally significant medicinal plants, their
            habitats, species, and genomes and promote their sustainable
            use in Sri Lanka. The project has three components. First,
            the expansion of in-situ conservation will include the
            installation of Medicinal Plant Conservation Areas (MPCAs)
            in five areas where there is active collection from the
            wild. Second, the expansion of ex-situ cultivation and
            conservation will improve existing nurseries, establish two
            new nurseries, research propagation, support home garden and
            plantation research, and disseminate research results.
            Third, the information and institutional support will
            promote an appropriate legal and policy environment through
            studies and recommendations for regulations; establishment
            of information network on medicinal plants; training;
            monitoring and evaluation; and support for project
            management, coordination, and advisory functions.
